intro: Tiniaria sachalinensis, commonly known as the Sakhalin tiniaria, is a rare flowering plant native to the Russian Far East. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
